intro: Impatiens longirama, commonly known as the long-stemmed impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and glossy, with a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often hairy. Impatiens longirama thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shade gardens.
